name: Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one of the smaller rooms and although we didn't spent a lot of time in the hotel it was a nice stay. Good location. Clean rooms. Very helpful and friendly staff. The breakfast is good. I was very hungover the day we checked out and managed to leave some documents and my montly travel card behind in the room! When I got back to the UK I called the hotel and they said that they kept all of it and will post it to me the next day. I received it 2 days later. They were very helpful and it was nice of them to keep what seemed like other people's junk. I will recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Had a nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is excellent!! We were there from sunday to wednesday before easter - days I know to be quiet in Amsterdam, so we got a great room at a low price: just €134 for a huge double with a lounge-corner by the huge corner bay-window overlooking Prinsengracht and Leidsestraat.
reviews.title: Excellent!!

likes.disliked: — Lift (elevator) - doors are hard to figure out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: There's a tramstop for lines 1, 2 and 5 (from Centraal Station) right outside (stop called "Prinsengracht")
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Amsterdam museum area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location very close by Leidseplein and walkingdistance (even for lazy me) to the the museums, is really fantastic!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Good Hotel
reviews.text: The room was clean and the decor tasteful - it's really spacious, which is unusual for old houses in Amsterdam!! It has an unbelievable view of the canal, and a really nice, and big bathroom (2 sinks and a tub).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just arrived back after spending three nights at this hotel. We booked it through KLM and it was such a great deal, return flights from Glasgow and hotel all for £165!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location
Excellent hotel and location
reviews.text: The hotel is extremely clean and although our room 205 had its faults (rock hard bed, sink from bathroom in room area, shower head not staying in place) overall the hotel was excellent. The breakfast provided is more than sufficient and there is a great choice of variety. The location of the hotel is perfect, Leidsplien area is certainly the best area to stay in and this hotel is right in the heart of it and is literally three steps away from the tram stop. Although the hotel is located in a busy area we were not bothered by the noise in our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would definately recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Will be returning to the Dikker and Thijs

likes.disliked: — No Safe is all I can come up with.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel! First, the location is excellent! You are literally a stone's throw from the tram stop on Leidsplain. Also, the Leidsplain Street is awesome, with tons of stores, eateries, souvenir shops, and just about anything you could ask for. Lots of small bars, including sports bars, and nightlife that is within easy walking distance---literally 5 minutes! Now to the hotel---staff is very friendly and courteous. From the moment you walk in, you can tell it is an above-average hotel. My room was excellent---large, clean, big comfortable bed, separate shower and bathroom. After staying at a low-budget hotel in London for 4 nights, I had my best 2 nights of sleep at this hotel. If I return to Amsterdam, I will definitely stay at this hotel and I strongly recommend it to others! Also, the hotel booking was simple---I booked through the hotel's website...they used my credit card to simply hold the room, then I paid in full with the same card at check-out. They also accomodated me by storing my suitcase in a side room, since I arrived several hours earlier than check-in time. Strongly recommend!
reviews.title: Dikker & Thijs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights at the Dikker and Thijs and can highly recommend it. We got a great deal on expedia, around £170pp for 3 nights and return flights from London, including breakfast (which we never got up in time for!). The room was huge with a view of the canal and the beds were clean and comfortable. Bathroom was also big and clean with an excellent fully adjustable shower with excellent pressure - great if you are a tall person as you dont have to duck your head to get it wet. Rooms had tv, minibar, desk, but no safe. Location is good, its about 20 minute walk to the RLD but you can catch a tram right next to the hotel. Overall it is quite central. Highly recommend this hotel and I will returning next time in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is well situated to be far enough from too much noise but is still within a 5 - 20 minute walk of most of the nightlife, attractions & parks, etc.
reviews.title: Great location, clean & tidy rooms, friendly, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, the breakfast was adequate and the staff were helpful and accomodating assisting me with storing my bags after check out, arranging my airport transfers and advising me of the best routes to take to find my way around the City.
reviews.title: Great location with a View of Canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were from America, visiting Amersterdam for three days. We picked Dikker & Thijs Hotel because of the canal view - and we weren't disappointed. We had a decent-sized room with big widows that opened up to a view of the canal. The room had lots of character and charm. (Note: Our room looked much different from the luxury rooms pictured on the website, but we were still very satisfied.)
reviews.title: Fab Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Step out the door and you're right next to a tram stop that can take you anywhere in the city. (Get off at the Prinsengracht stop and you're right in front of the hotel.) You're right by Leidesplein, so it's a bustling area with lots of restaurants, bars, shops, street performers, and fun attractions.
reviews.title: Highly recommended, would visit again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The noise from the street does continue on into the wee hours of the morning, so if you're looking for a "quiet" retreat, this might not be it. But we didin't mind too much, since we felt like we were in the center of all the activity.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Dikker in September 2011. Absolutely the best location. Others complained about noise, etc. We had a room with balcony overlooking canal. It was so interesting watching the boaters. Not a problem at all. Room was a superior room with king bed, very large with wonderful amenities. If there was one fault was that the room had a tub with shower. It was very slippery when wet so be very careful getting in and out. Found staff very helpful answering questions. Again, great location for museums and general sightseeing in a good area. Does appear pricey but it's Amsterdam and a boutique hotel!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with my wife 3 nights on 1st Oct. (her birthday present). We had a large double on the 2nd floor. The bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean. From other reviews we were well aware of the noise level from trams and late night revellers. We missed breakfast as we went to bed late and it would have been a struggle to get up early. There is tea and coffee making facilities in the room and a Starbucks just opp. the hotel. The staff are very nice and helpful. Then the location. Just a minute from Leidesplein with all its bars restaurants coffee shops night clubs and so near to the museums. So for all of these our next stay will surely be the Dikker again.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My son and I stayed here for 4 nights mid september. We had a very large room with twin beds and a seating area that had doors with Juliette balcony overlooking the canal. Had not booked a canal view room but were given one anyway. Our room was on the 2nd floor around the corner from all the noise of trams and late night drinkers so we weren't bothered by any noise.Had breakfast on 2 occasions had plenty of choice but somewhat extorionate price of 17 euros.Reception staff variable mostly pleasant but one staff member pretty disinterested answering questions.Internet in our room poor signal so mostly used the lounge area on 2nd floor for internet access.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thought overall rather expensive but location very central to Museums, Anne Frank house and lovely Jordaan area.Would use hotel again
reviews.title: Not worth 4 stars, but good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room was a disappointment : the bed was packed between 2 walls, which means the only possibility to go to bed was from the feet side. No space to put glasses or a watch. Furthermore, the room was overall noisy, as the phonic isolation seemed weak. I wrote an email to the staff to mention those points, but never received any answer...
reviews.title: Pleasant stay near everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To get the feel of Amsterdam you must stay near the canals and this hotel on the Prinsengracht is a winner. A great location in a beautiful old building, close to shopping, food and drink. Buy an "I amsterdam City Card" and see the city. The trams are convenient and are a short walk from the hotel. Hotels in Amsterdam tend to be expensive so it was a pleasant surprise to find such delightful accommodation (in a character hotel) at a reasonable price. This is not a big chain hotel with a full service front desk but it is a quaint, clean and comfortable spot from which to explore the city and take refuge when tired. We were satisfied with the basic breakfast found in the basement cafe. We would come back.
reviews.title: Enchantment in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh my... where do I start? As you will have gathered from the other reviews, the location of this hotel is perfect for getting to all the main attractions and galleries of Amsterdam on foot. The price you pay for this convenience is noise and not exactly the most picturesque position in this beautiful city. Yes, the hotel is on the wonderful Prinsengracht canal, but it's also on a terribly busy corner and opposite a chip shop and a kebab shop on the main drag down to Leidesplein.
reviews.title: 5 Star Location with 3 Star Rooms...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: If you want a romantic, quiet retreat on a canal, this definitely isn't it. If you want to be in the heart of the action though, give it a whirl. Our room overlooked the main street and it was very noisy, (probably stoned) mayhem well into the early hours. The room also had no air-con, so we had the fan provided right next to the bed just to stay semi-cool (it was way too noisy to have the window open...).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in a great part of Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The rooms aren't comparable with other 4 star hotels I've stayed in: they are more akin to 3 star, but perfectly comfortable (except for the air con). But the corridors etc are a real let down here - very poor stairwells that have a dark, depressing institutionalised feel about them. We did find the reception staff very friendly and efficient, so plus points there. However, the maid service was just bizarre: we literally had someone hanging around outside our door waiting for us to leave for breakfast each day! This wasn't late, by the way - it was around 8:00-8:30am. It happened for 3 days on the trot: there they were waiting for us to leave, and then they would be inside the room before we'd even reached the stairs! It was kind of comical, kind of creepy.
reviews.title: underrated excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were in Amsterdam again for 1 night, I'd consider this place for its convenience. But for a longer stay, I'd be seeking somewhere a bit quieter.
reviews.title: We won't be back because of the staff and the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small hotel, the room was nice, staff pleasant, terrific location in the middle of everything. Negatives are some street noise (it is on a major intersection), no A/C, absolutely terrible breakfast for which you have to pay extra (but there are many cafes and restaurants nearby.) Be careful about the room rate, I have stayed at very similar quality hotels in Amsterdam for half the price.
reviews.title: Pleasant small hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights as part of a bike tour trip from Amsterdam to Paris. We were shocked at how large our room was! The bathroom was spacious and very clean. The view of the canal in front of the hotel was wonderful! It was a little noisy outside in the evening but we closed the large windows and it was quiet. There was no safe bike parking at the hotel but we found a bike parking garage not far away. Great hotel for the money! The various people at the front desk were helpful, too.
reviews.title: Great hotel, location, and price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are a family of three, two adults and a 10-year-old. We booked a room based on a Fodor's review. What a disappointment! The only room they had for three was on the tram (elecdtric trolley) side and it was VERY noisy. The room did not have AC, but we had to close the windows at night due to the noise. The tram stops running around midnight and doesn't start up again until about 7:30 a.m. (I think), so it might be okay for someone who goes to bed later and gets up on the early side. Also, the carpet was icky. The rooms facing the canal might be nicer. Location is very good, but there are a lot of hotels with great locations because Amsterdam is a smallish city. We ended up moving to the Bilderberg Hotel -- a little more expensive -- and it was WONDERFUL!
reviews.title: Very noisy rooms, not that nice, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great room on the 1st floor (our second floor in US) over looking the Prisengracht canal. Location is wonderful, tram stop right outside the front door. Lots of restaurants and bars and entertainment just around the corner. The room was spacious for European standards. Great bed, very comfortable with great pillows. My room had air conditioning which was great just to cut the stuffiness in the room. Bathroom was spacious and the shower great. Front desk workers were very friendly, always greeting you as you entered or left. Did not eat the breakfast as there are lots of bakeries around. I highly suggest this hotel and will definately stay here again when I return to Amsterdam!!
reviews.title: Clean, Great Location, Good A/C

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we walked in the door to the moment we walked out, this hotel catered to our every need. We rented the Penthouse for four days for a VERY reasonable price, which included breakfast the first morning (brought to our room, of course). It was a lavish spread! They also had a fresh bouquet of a dozen roses waiting for us when we got there the evening before. The view of the City of Amsterdam from the room was amazing, the space was very large and the king-sized bed was super comfy. We'd read other reviews about noise (it is right at the corner of a main stop for the trams) but we never heard a thing. We loved it!
reviews.title: LOVED IT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel is located in a beautiful area, many great dinner choices and on the canel. The staff were very helpful with directions to local sites as well as the usual tourist hot spots. They also make taxi arrangements at a discounted price for the guests.
reviews.title: Amsterdam Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tram stops directly in front of the hotel- making access to the Central Station & The Dam Square a simple 7.00 Euro ride for a full day all over the city.
reviews.title: Great staff, great location, can be a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms have flat screen tvs, large bathtubs- blow driers ( which are unusual to find provided in the rooms) in room coffee and a beautiful view.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: This is a desirable location, I will stay here again on future trips.
reviews.title: Best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel were really great-- efficient and very friendly. Our room was fantastic....huge. I was expecting some tiny little closet (as is often the case in older cities). Instead, they gave us the triple room which had an extra twin bed in addition to a small table/chair set-up. Very comfortable.
reviews.title: Good spot
Great hotel
reviews.text: I went with two other single women and shared a big comfortable bedroom. Everything was as described and the staff were very helpful and friendly.Breakfast was excellent and we were given a free welcome drink. The area is excellent too with a great selection of restaurants and bars but it felt comfortable to us away from the centre of the city. The trams stop right outside the hotel and are very frequent. A great stay, we will definitely stay here again when we return.

reviews.title: Highly Disappointed
reviews.text: My partner and I plus another couple were looking forward to staying at Dikker en Thijs for a long weekend in Amsterdam. I chose the hotel because I had lived in Amsterdam for ten years and had always wanted to stay there based on its reputation for being one of the best--NOT SO! I think it is time the hotel had its star status reviewed and at least one star revoked. From the moment we arrived at the hotel to check in we were treated coldly by reception. The rooms were by no means up to any four star standard I have ever experienced (our friends' bedding was stained). The rooms we were assigned were unappealingly decorated. All in all the staff was unhelpful and aloof. The only good thing about the hotel is its location and the breakfast was satisfactory. I would not recommend this hotel, especially as a four star category.

reviews.title: excellent
reviews.text: This hotel is very well located just a stones throw from the Leidseplein , and close to loads of restaurants, and tram. Had booked a single room and was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a superior double, hence the good review. Would definitely stay again, hopefully soon. Great location friendly staff and clean. Particularly good in summer time , near Leides square.

reviews.title: Fall in love with Amsterdam and the hotel!!!
reviews.text: We had our Honeymoon (7-12 May 2007) at Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel and it was the best that we could have done!!! We booked the Honeymoon package and stayed at the penthouse suite. It wa just great.

reviews.title: Canal view? -well a couple of garbage cans!
reviews.text: The room was huge, consisting of a double sitting area (a sitting area with two armchairs and a table and one sitting area with a dining table and two dining chairs) , a seperate space with a working desk and the seperate area of bedroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 504, the top floor of the hotel, facing the canal. This was our second stay at the hotel. The location is great – Amsterdam is a small town, and the hotel is located a quick walk or tram to all venues. We requested a high floor because the area is so touristy and the crowds linger long into the evening. We heard no street noise. The bed was very nice. The bathroom has no shade/curtain/privacy – so you’ll be a bit exhibitionist while you suds up – but the fifth floor is higher than most other buildings around, so not a huge deal. There’s a small, shabby balcony with two chairs. The balcony could really use a makeover and would be a great selling point. Right now it’s an ugly afterthought with poor, uneven and wet flooring and no charm. The room is large, feels a bit worn down. There’s duct tape on the A/C unit, the first thing I noted. Because this hotel is not cheap – and we had a good experience here three years ago – I was disappointed with the room quality. There’s nothing in the way of amenities – no robes, slippers or good bath products. You can get room service but it’ll cost you 10 euros. Wifi is extra. The front desk was efficient. So – the hotel is in a good location and the room experience was OK. Not great, not horrible, just fine. Considering the cost, this hotel could make small improvements that would make a huge difference. Just a few plants and some attention to the balcony would be a great start – and maybe some nice bath products. We won’t return.
reviews.title: Great location - but a lack of attention to the little things that make a hotel stay memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location on a canal and in a happenin' part of town, the Leidseplein. You can walk everywhere from this hotel. Staff is gracious, knowledgeable, and very helpful. Our room was a LOVELY surprise, large and spacious, clean and well appointed. This is one of the few hotels are that is equipped with an elevator, and in Amsterdam with the narrow stairways, that amenity is PRICELESS. Our only complaint would have to be the tram RIGHT outside our window. Had to sleep with earplugs. The suites on the backside of the hotel are much larger but super quiet, and of course more expensive. Couldn't beat the location and the staff. Might I also recommend the small corner Pattiserie across the street for FANTABULOUS eats.
reviews.title: Great location in such a fun town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looing for an hotel in a great location - overlooking the canal - you couldn't do better. It is perfectly situated for museums galleries and the sites all in a short walk. The room we had - paid for overlooking the canal - was very roomy, light and comfortable.
reviews.title: To be recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Didn't eat in the hotel - why would you when such tremedous options nearby and the breakfast is expec=nsive - as everyone says - so eat at a nearby cafe. Surprisingly quiet for one so well located.
reviews.title: Amsterdam Magic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location in old Amsterdam. Ideal for business or pleasure. The hotel is located in a busy (and touresty) part of Amsterdam with plenty of restaurants and bars in the area. Good for business as it is right in the tram line.
reviews.title: a little pearl in amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a few nights in early November. Had a very pleasant, large double room up in the eaves, overlooking the canal. Comfortable bed, good bathroom with plenty of hot water, shampoos, shower gel, etc. All very clean and tidy. Breakfast was ok but nothing special, staff were very polite and helpful.
reviews.title: A pleasant, wonderfully situated hotel
Definitely recommended staying here
reviews.text: Very conveniently situated, the tram stop is only a few yards from the hotel so you can easily get to and from the station and see the many sights of the city. There are also lots of shops, restaurants, bars and clubs nearby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a lovely room on the first floor, overlooking the canal which was beautiful. Very spacious room after reading lots of reviews saying that there was a lack of space in Amsterdam rooms in general. Friends of ours did get a small room at the back of the building though, with a view over other buildings. Paying extra for the canal view was definitely worth it. Very good location. Easy to get to all the main attractions. Eight of us stayed there, and we all said we'd definitely stay there again in the future if we return to Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Great location, big room, helpful front desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a very large room overlooking the canal, much less claustrophobic than most European rooms. The front desk staff were very helpful with restaurant and attraction information. Location was great - easy walk to museums, many restaurants. Very handy to have the main tram lines (1 and 2) a few steps from the door. Only downside was very skimpy, expensive breakfast, but there's a good bakery right across the street. Some late night noise from nearby bar but that goes with a great location.
reviews.title: too bad housekeeping stole my expensive binoculars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stopped in Amsterdam en route to Africa, and stayed at this place due to its central location, and good reviews on TripAdvisor. we had 2 rooms: one with a balcony which we paid extra for; but we enjoyed the view immensely, and felt it was worth the extra cost. as we were riding bikes and generally touring the city, i took my binoculars out of my backpack since i did not need them. we were about to embark on a 5 week african safari, and had been warned numerous times by everyone to watch our valuables while on that continent: little did i realize i should have watched what we left in our room in Amsterdam! needless to say, 5 long weeks without my image stabilizing binocs left me with a bitter taste in my mouth for the Dikker & Thijs.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great location and rooms with wonderful European breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel in Jan 2007 for business.
reviews.title: OK Amsterdam hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a fairly basic hotel with some nice touches. I booked a superior double room which was very large. Nice big bathroom, with lovely shower. The room had 2 twin beds, desk, minibar, tea / coffee making facilities, satelitte TV and pay movies. I was impressed with the room….until I tried to sleep! The noise from the street comes mostly from the trams – trams in both directions have to use 1 tram line for a 20m stretch and the way they indicate to eachother who is coming through is to ring the bell. Fine – except when it’s every 5 minutes at midnight. There is also a lot of noise from the party goers that wander past at 3am. The hotel doesn’t seem to have done much to try and combat the noise – no double glazing.
reviews.title: high standard Dutch hotel but not a 4 stars

likes.disliked: — the front desk staff and the noise from the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006
reviews.text: The front desk girls are fine and very friendly – but please try not to get the manager. He’s terribly patronising, and when I tried to book for a night the week after he told me the best rate was twice what it was on expedia. I explained this… but to no avail. He told me to book through Expedia, not directly with him!
reviews.title: great location - bit shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wireless internet is 6 Euros per hour.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

likes.liked: — the size of the room, and its closeness to all amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Trams go right past – a blessing and a curse. You’re right in the heart of lovely Amsterdam with Centraal Station only a 10 min tram ride away.
reviews.title: Took a chance on the D&T, and it paid off

likes.disliked: — Old-fashioned elevator. You have to manually open it when it arrives at your floor, and it bangs shut when you get in. I never felt it was unsafe; just mildly annoying.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights in room #308. A very large room with double bed (actually two twin beds pushed together), big bathroom and nice view of canal. Sitting area looks out on canal with floor-to-ceiling windows that open wide. In-room coffee maker and mini fridge. Huge armoire. Bathroom has no natural light but room gets lots of light. Helpful and efficient staff. Our room faced the quiet side of the street, while just around the corner there are tons of shops (inc coffee shops), bars, stores and restaurants. Easy walk to Anne Frank House and Van Gogh Museum. Tram right out the door. The beds were hard, but European beds always seem that way. The layout of the floors is a bit unusual - to get to our room we took an elevator then had to go up a flight of stairs. A bit tricky with luggage and no help finding room or carrying luggage was offered (we found a housekeeper who kindly helped). We had trouble sleeping - the tram noise was noticeable and our upstairs neighbors apparently were a family of ballet-dancing elephants (or they may have been walking normally and it's just nature of the rooms).
reviews.title: Well located, efficient staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is right on a tram stop on the Prinsengracht canal, perfectly situated for shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Well located for seeing the sights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very comfortable and spacious room on the 2nd floor - our window was just above the "Thijs" sign on the outside of the building! The room was well-equipped with minibar and tea & coffee making facilities. Lovely shower room with complimentary toiletries and face cloths too. I think the rooms must have been recently refurished as there was a faint smell of paint in the air - and the room and shower room were spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Mediocre Hotel With Some Quiks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We could hear the noise from the trams and there are lots of people around at night but we were pretty tired from walking around the sights so we slept really well anyway.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Well Priced, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't get breakfast at the hotel but instead got some croissants from the bakers across the street. They were lovely - highly recommended!
reviews.title: excellent location

description: Tucked behind a historical façade right along the Prinsengracht, the Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel provides you an exclusive gateway to discover Amsterdam. The Hotel is located in the heart of the canal district that was added to the UNESCO World Heritage List.Most of the comfortable, spacious and stylish rooms offer a beautiful view over the canal. Within walking distance are located: the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum, the Stedelijk Museum and the Anne Frank Huis. Also in the neighborhood: the Concertgebouw, theatres, cinemas, the Heineken Brewery, the Diamond Centre, starting points of Canal Cruises and the main shopping streets. The Spiegelkwartier starts 100 meters from the hotel and this historical neighborhood offers over seventy specialized shops with a wide variety of art and antiques. On the Leidseplein (only 50 meters away) numerous restaurants and cafés can be found.
